content: What two-word term, originating from a Latin phrase meaning "in the place of a parent," is used to describe the legal responsibility of an institution or individual to take on some of the functions and responsibilities of a parent?

The two-word term you're referring to is "in loco parentis." It originates from the Latin phrase meaning "in the place of a parent" and is used to describe the legal responsibility of an institution or individual to assume some of the functions and responsibilities of a parent. This concept is often applied in educational settings, where schools and teachers are expected to look after the welfare and safety of students in the absence of their parents.
